using serialize_pubrel_message_handler = std::function< void(basic_pubrel_message< PacketIdBytes > msg)>
 Serialize pubrel handler You can serialize the pubrel message. If your storage has already had the publish message that has the same packet_id, then you need to replace the publish message to pubrel message. To restore the message, use restore_serialized_message(). More...

void disconnect (MQTT_NS::optional< std::uint8_t > reason=MQTT_NS::nullopt, std::vector< v5::property_variant > props={})
 Disconnect Send a disconnect packet to the connected broker. It is a clean disconnecting sequence. The broker disconnects the endpoint after receives the disconnect packet.
When the endpoint disconnects using disconnect(), a will won't send.
See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901205
More...
 
void force_disconnect ()
 Disconnect by endpoint Force disconnect. It is not a clean disconnect sequence.
When the endpoint disconnects using force_disconnect(), a will will send.
More...

packet_id_t acquire_unique_packet_id ()
 Acquire the new unique packet id. If all packet ids are already in use, then throw packet_id_exhausted_error exception. After acquiring the packet id, you can call acquired_* functions. The ownership of packet id is moved to the library. Or you can call release_packet_id to release it. More...
 
bool register_packet_id (packet_id_t packet_id)
 Register packet_id to the library. After registering the packet_id, you can call acquired_* functions. The ownership of packet id is moved to the library. Or you can call release_packet_id to release it. More...

bool connected () const
 Check connection status. More...
 
void set_mqtt_message_processed_handler (mqtt_message_processed_handler h=mqtt_message_processed_handler())
 Set custom mqtt_message_processed_handler. The default setting is calling async_read_control_packet_type(). (See endpoint() constructor). The typical usecase of this function is delaying the next message reading timing. In order to do that 1) store func parameter of the mqtt_message_processed_handler. 2) call async_read_next_message with the stored func if you are ready to read the next mqtt message. More...
 
mqtt_message_processed_handler get_mqtt_message_processed_handler () const
 Get mqtt_message_processed_handler. More...
 
void async_read_next_message (async_handler_t func)
 Trigger next mqtt message manually. If you call this function, you need to set manual receive mode using set_auto_next_read(false);. More...
 
void set_max_queue_send_count (std::size_t count)
 Set maximum number of queued message sending. When async message sending function called during asynchronous processing, the message is enqueued. When current asynchronous message is processed, then concatenate queued messages and send it. This value limits the maximum number of concatenating messages. The default value is 1. More...
 
void set_max_queue_send_size (std::size_t size)
 Set maximum size of queued message sending. When async message sending function called during asynchronous processing, the message is enqueued. When current asynchronous message is processed, then concatenate queued messages and send it. This value limits the maximum size of concatenating messages. The default value is 0. More...

Member Typedef Documentation

◆ async_handler_t

template<typename Mutex = std::mutex, template< typename... > class LockGuard = std::lock_guard, std::size_t PacketIdBytes = 2>
using MQTT_NS::endpoint< Mutex, LockGuard, PacketIdBytes >::async_handler_t = std::function<void(boost::system::error_code const& ec)>

◆ close_handler

template<typename Mutex = std::mutex, template< typename... > class LockGuard = std::lock_guard, std::size_t PacketIdBytes = 2>
using MQTT_NS::endpoint< Mutex, LockGuard, PacketIdBytes >::close_handler = std::function<void()>

Close handler.

This handler is called if the client called disconnect() and the server closed the socket cleanly. If the socket is closed by other reasons, error_handler is called.

◆ error_handler

Error handler.

This handler is called if the socket is closed without client's disconnect() call.

Parameters
ecerror code

Parameters
msgpublish message

◆ serialize_pubrel_handler

template<typename Mutex = std::mutex, template< typename... > class LockGuard = std::lock_guard, std::size_t PacketIdBytes = 2>
using MQTT_NS::endpoint< Mutex, LockGuard, PacketIdBytes >::serialize_pubrel_handler = std::function<void(packet_id_t packet_id, char const* data, std::size_t size)>

Serialize pubrel handler You can serialize the pubrel message. If your storage has already had the publish message that has the same packet_id, then you need to replace the publish message to pubrel message. To restore the message, use restore_serialized_message().

Parameters
packet_idpacket identifier of the serializing message
datapointer to the serializing message
sizesize of the serializing message

Member Function Documentation

◆ acquire_unique_packet_id()

template<typename Mutex = std::mutex, template< typename... > class LockGuard = std::lock_guard, std::size_t PacketIdBytes = 2>
packet_id_t MQTT_NS::endpoint< Mutex, LockGuard, PacketIdBytes >::acquire_unique_packet_id ( )
inline

Acquire the new unique packet id. If all packet ids are already in use, then throw packet_id_exhausted_error exception. After acquiring the packet id, you can call acquired_* functions. The ownership of packet id is moved to the library. Or you can call release_packet_id to release it.

Returns
packet id

◆ acquired_async_publish() [1/4]

template<typename Mutex = std::mutex, template< typename... > class LockGuard = std::lock_guard, std::size_t PacketIdBytes = 2>
void MQTT_NS::endpoint< Mutex, LockGuard, PacketIdBytes >::acquired_async_publish ( packet_id_t  packet_id,
std::string  topic_name,
std::string  contents,
std::uint8_t  qos = qos::at_most_once,
bool  retain = false,
async_handler_t  func = async_handler_t() 
)
inline

Publish with a manual set packet identifier.

Parameters
packet_idpacket identifier. It should be acquired by acquire_unique_packet_id, or register_packet_id. The ownership of the packet_id moves to the library. If qos == qos::at_most_once, packet_id must be 0. But not checked in release mode due to performance.
topic_nameA topic name to publish
contentsThe contents to publish
qosMQTT_NS::qos
retainA retain flag. If set it to true, the contents is retained.
https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901104
3.3.1.3 RETAIN
funcfunctor object who's operator() will be called when the async operation completes.

◆ acquired_async_publish() [2/4]

template<typename Mutex = std::mutex, template< typename... > class LockGuard = std::lock_guard, std::size_t PacketIdBytes = 2>
void MQTT_NS::endpoint< Mutex, LockGuard, PacketIdBytes >::acquired_async_publish ( packet_id_t  packet_id,
std::string  topic_name,
std::string  contents,
std::uint8_t  qos,
bool  retain,
std::vector< v5::property_variant >  props,
async_handler_t  func = async_handler_t() 
)
inline

Publish with a manual set packet identifier.

Parameters
packet_idpacket identifier. It should be acquired by acquire_unique_packet_id, or register_packet_id. The ownership of the packet_id moves to the library. If qos == qos::at_most_once, packet_id must be 0. But not checked in release mode due to performance.
topic_nameA topic name to publish
contentsThe contents to publish
qosMQTT_NS::qos
retainA retain flag. If set it to true, the contents is retained.
https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901104
3.3.1.3 RETAIN
propsProperties
See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901109
3.3.2.3 PUBLISH Properties
funcfunctor object who's operator() will be called when the async operation completes.

◆ acquired_async_publish() [3/4]

template<typename Mutex = std::mutex, template< typename... > class LockGuard = std::lock_guard, std::size_t PacketIdBytes = 2>
void MQTT_NS::endpoint< Mutex, LockGuard, PacketIdBytes >::acquired_async_publish ( packet_id_t  packet_id,
as::const_buffer  topic_name,
as::const_buffer  contents,
MQTT_NS::any  life_keeper,
std::uint8_t  qos = qos::at_most_once,
bool  retain = false,
async_handler_t  func = async_handler_t() 
)
inline

Publish with a manual set packet identifier.

Parameters
packet_idpacket identifier. It should be acquired by acquire_unique_packet_id, or register_packet_id. The ownership of the packet_id moves to the library. If qos == qos::at_most_once, packet_id must be 0. But not checked in release mode due to performance.
topic_nameA topic name to publish
contentsThe contents to publish
life_keeperAn object that stays alive (but is moved with std::move()) until the async operation is finished.
qosMQTT_NS::qos
retainA retain flag. If set it to true, the contents is retained.
https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901104
3.3.1.3 RETAIN
funcfunctor object who's operator() will be called when the async operation completes.

◆ acquired_async_publish() [4/4]

template<typename Mutex = std::mutex, template< typename... > class LockGuard = std::lock_guard, std::size_t PacketIdBytes = 2>

std::uint8_t  qos = qos::at_most_once,
bool  retain = false,
async_handler_t  func = async_handler_t() 
)
inline

Publish as dup with a manual set packet identifier.

Parameters
packet_idpacket identifier. It should be acquired by acquire_unique_packet_id, or register_packet_id. The ownership of the packet_id moves to the library. If qos == qos::at_most_once, packet_id must be 0. But not checked in release mode due to performance.
topic_nameA topic name to publish
contentsThe contents to publish
qosMQTT_NS::qos
retainA retain flag. If set it to true, the contents is retained.
https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901104

template<typename Mutex = std::mutex, template< typename... > class LockGuard = std::lock_guard, std::size_t PacketIdBytes = 2>
template<typename Arg0 , typename... Args>
void MQTT_NS::endpoint< Mutex, LockGuard, PacketIdBytes >::acquired_async_subscribe ( packet_id_t  packet_id,
std::string  topic_name,
std::uint8_t  option,
Arg0 &&  arg0,
Args &&...  args 
)
inline

Subscribe with a manual set packet identifier.

Parameters
packet_idpacket identifier. It should be acquired by acquire_unique_packet_id, or register_packet_id. The ownership of the packet_id moves to the library.
topic_nameA topic name to subscribe
optionsubscription options
See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901169
3.8.3.1 Subscription Options
argsThe format of args is [topic_name, option, topicname, option, ...,][props,][func]
args should be zero or more pairs of topic_name and option. You can set props optionally. See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901164
3.8.2.1 SUBSCRIBE Properties You can set a callback function that is called when async operation will finish. You can subscribe multiple topics all at once.

◆ acquired_async_subscribe() [2/10]

◆ acquired_async_subscribe() [7/10]

template<typename Mutex = std::mutex, template< typename... > class LockGuard = std::lock_guard, std::size_t PacketIdBytes = 2>
void MQTT_NS::endpoint< Mutex, LockGuard, PacketIdBytes >::acquired_async_subscribe ( packet_id_t  packet_id,
std::vector< std::tuple< std::string, std::uint8_t >>  params,
async_handler_t  func = async_handler_t() 
)
inline

Subscribe.

Parameters
packet_idpacket identifier. It should be acquired by acquire_unique_packet_id, or register_packet_id. The ownership of the packet_id moves to the library.
paramsA collection of the pair of topic_name and option to subscribe.
See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901169
3.8.3.1 Subscription Options
funcfunctor object who's operator() will be called when the async operation completes. You can subscribe multiple topics all at once.
See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901161

◆ acquired_async_unsubscribe() [1/6]

template<typename Mutex = std::mutex, template< typename... > class LockGuard = std::lock_guard, std::size_t PacketIdBytes = 2>
template<typename Arg0 , typename... Args>
void MQTT_NS::endpoint< Mutex, LockGuard, PacketIdBytes >::acquired_async_unsubscribe ( packet_id_t  packet_id,
std::string  topic_name,
Arg0 &&  arg0,
Args &&...  args 
)
inline

Unsubscribe.

Parameters
packet_idpacket identifier. It should be acquired by acquire_unique_packet_id, or register_packet_id. The ownership of the packet_id moves to the library.
topic_nametopic_name
argsThe format of args is [topic_name, topicname, ... , ][props,][func]
args should be some topic_names to unsubscribe,
You can set props optionally. See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901182
3.10.2.1 UNSUBSCRIBE Properties You can set a callback function that is called when async operation will finish. You can subscribe multiple topics all at once.
See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901161

◆ acquired_async_unsubscribe() [2/6]

◆ acquired_publish() [1/2]

template<typename Mutex = std::mutex, template< typename... > class LockGuard = std::lock_guard, std::size_t PacketIdBytes = 2>
void MQTT_NS::endpoint< Mutex, LockGuard, PacketIdBytes >::acquired_publish ( packet_id_t  packet_id,
std::string  topic_name,
std::string  contents,
std::uint8_t  qos = qos::at_most_once,
bool  retain = false,
std::vector< v5::property_variant >  props = {} 
)
inline

Publish with already acquired packet identifier.

Parameters
packet_idpacket identifier. It should be acquired by acquire_unique_packet_id, or register_packet_id. The ownership of the packet_id moves to the library. If qos == qos::at_most_once, packet_id must be 0. But not checked in release mode due to performance.
topic_nameA topic name to publish
contentsThe contents to publish
qosMQTT_NS::qos
retainA retain flag. If set it to true, the contents is retained.
https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901104
3.3.1.3 RETAIN
propsProperties
See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901109
3.3.2.3 PUBLISH Properties

◆ acquired_publish() [2/2]

template<typename Mutex = std::mutex, template< typename... > class LockGuard = std::lock_guard, std::size_t PacketIdBytes = 2>
void MQTT_NS::endpoint< Mutex, LockGuard, PacketIdBytes >::acquired_publish ( packet_id_t  packet_id,
as::const_buffer  topic_name,
as::const_buffer  contents,
MQTT_NS::any  life_keeper,
std::uint8_t  qos = qos::at_most_once,
bool  retain = false,
std::vector< v5::property_variant >  props = {} 
)
inline

Publish with already acquired packet identifier.

Parameters
packet_idpacket identifier. It should be acquired by acquire_unique_packet_id, or register_packet_id. The ownership of the packet_id moves to the library. If qos == qos::at_most_once, packet_id must be 0. But not checked in release mode due to performance.
topic_nameA topic name to publish
contentsThe contents to publish
life_keeperAn object that stays alive (but is moved with std::move()) until the async operation is finished.
qosMQTT_NS::qos
retainA retain flag. If set it to true, the contents is retained.
https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901104
3.3.1.3 RETAIN
propsProperties
See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901109
3.3.2.3 PUBLISH Properties

std::vector< v5::property_variant >  props = {} 
)
inline

Publish as dup with already acquired packet identifier.

Parameters
packet_idpacket identifier. It should be acquired by acquire_unique_packet_id, or register_packet_id. The ownership of the packet_id moves to the library. If qos == qos::at_most_once, packet_id must be 0. But not checked in release mode due to performance.
topic_nameA topic name to publish
contentsThe contents to publish
qosMQTT_NS::qos
retainA retain flag. If set it to true, the contents is retained.

template<typename Mutex = std::mutex, template< typename... > class LockGuard = std::lock_guard, std::size_t PacketIdBytes = 2>
template<typename... Args>
void MQTT_NS::endpoint< Mutex, LockGuard, PacketIdBytes >::acquired_subscribe ( packet_id_t  packet_id,
Args &&...  args 
)
inline

Subscribe with already acquired packet identifier.

Parameters
packet_idpacket identifier. It should be acquired by acquire_unique_packet_id, or register_packet_id. The ownership of the packet_id moves to the library.
argsargs should be one or more pairs of topic_name and qos.

You can set props as the last argument optionally. See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901164
3.8.2.1 SUBSCRIBE Properties You can subscribe multiple topics all at once.
See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901161

◆ acquired_subscribe() [2/3]

std::vector< std::tuple< MQTT_NS::string_view, std::uint8_t >>  params,
std::vector< v5::property_variant >  props = {} 
)

Parameters

paramsa vector of the topic_filter and qos pair.

See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901161

◆ acquired_subscribe() [3/3]

template<typename Mutex = std::mutex, template< typename... > class LockGuard = std::lock_guard, std::size_t PacketIdBytes = 2>
void MQTT_NS::endpoint< Mutex, LockGuard, PacketIdBytes >::acquired_subscribe ( packet_id_t  packet_id,
std::vector< std::tuple< as::const_buffer, std::uint8_t >>  params,
std::vector< v5::property_variant >  props = {} 
)
inline

Subscribe with already acquired packet identifier.

Parameters
packet_idpacket identifier. It should be acquired by acquire_unique_packet_id, or register_packet_id. The ownership of the packet_id moves to the library.
paramsa vector of the topic_filter and qos pair.
propsProperties
See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901164

◆ acquired_unsubscribe() [1/3]

void MQTT_NS::endpoint< Mutex, LockGuard, PacketIdBytes >::acquired_unsubscribe ( packet_id_t  packet_id,
Args &&...  args 
)
inline

Unsubscribe with already acquired packet identifier.

Parameters
packet_idpacket identifier. It should be acquired by acquire_unique_packet_id, or register_packet_id. The ownership of the packet_id moves to the library.
argsargs should be one or more topic names to unsubscribe to

You can set props as the last argument optionally. See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901182
3.10.2.1 UNSUBSCRIBE Properties You can subscribe multiple topics all at once.

◆ async_disconnect() [1/2]

template<typename Mutex = std::mutex, template< typename... > class LockGuard = std::lock_guard, std::size_t PacketIdBytes = 2>
void MQTT_NS::endpoint< Mutex, LockGuard, PacketIdBytes >::async_disconnect ( async_handler_t  func = async_handler_t())
inline

Disconnect.

Parameters
funcfunctor object who's operator() will be called when the async operation completes. Send a disconnect packet to the connected broker. It is a clean disconnecting sequence. The broker disconnects the endpoint after receives the disconnect packet.
When the endpoint disconnects using disconnect(), a will won't send.

◆ async_disconnect() [2/2]

funcfunctor object who's operator() will be called when the async operation completes. Send a disconnect packet to the connected broker. It is a clean disconnecting sequence. The broker disconnects the endpoint after receives the disconnect packet.
When the endpoint disconnects using disconnect(), a will won't send.

template<typename Mutex = std::mutex, template< typename... > class LockGuard = std::lock_guard, std::size_t PacketIdBytes = 2>
packet_id_t MQTT_NS::endpoint< Mutex, LockGuard, PacketIdBytes >::async_publish ( std::string  topic_name,
std::string  contents,
std::uint8_t  qos = qos::at_most_once,
bool  retain = false,
async_handler_t  func = async_handler_t() 
)
inline

Publish.

Parameters
topic_nameA topic name to publish
contentsThe contents to publish
qosMQTT_NS::qos
retainA retain flag. If set it to true, the contents is retained.
https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901104
3.3.1.3 RETAIN
funcfunctor object who's operator() will be called when the async operation completes.
Returns
packet_id. If qos is set to at_most_once, return 0. packet_id is automatically generated.

◆ async_publish() [2/8]

async_handler_t  func = async_handler_t() 
)

Publish.

Parameters
topic_nameA topic name to publish
contentsThe contents to publish
life_keeperAn object that stays alive (but is moved with std::move()) until the async operation is finished.

retainA retain flag. If set it to true, the contents is retained.

template<typename Mutex = std::mutex, template< typename... > class LockGuard = std::lock_guard, std::size_t PacketIdBytes = 2>
bool MQTT_NS::endpoint< Mutex, LockGuard, PacketIdBytes >::async_publish ( packet_id_t  packet_id,
std::string  topic_name,
std::string  contents,
std::uint8_t  qos = qos::at_most_once,
bool  retain = false,
async_handler_t  func = async_handler_t() 
)
inline

Publish with a manual set packet identifier.

Parameters
packet_idpacket identifier
topic_nameA topic name to publish
contentsThe contents to publish
qosMQTT_NS::qos
retainA retain flag. If set it to true, the contents is retained.
https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901104
3.3.1.3 RETAIN
life_keeperAn object that stays alive (but is moved with std::move()) until the async operation is finished.
Returns
If packet_id is used in the publishing/subscribing sequence, then returns false and contents don't publish, otherwise return true and contents publish.

◆ async_publish() [6/8]

retainA retain flag. If set it to true, the contents is retained.
https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901104
3.3.1.3 RETAIN
propsProperties
See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901109
3.3.2.3 PUBLISH Properties
funcfunctor object who's operator() will be called when the async operation completes.
Returns
If packet_id is used in the publishing/subscribing sequence, then returns false and contents don't publish, otherwise return true and contents publish.

◆ async_publish_at_least_once() [1/8]

template<typename Mutex = std::mutex, template< typename... > class LockGuard = std::lock_guard, std::size_t PacketIdBytes = 2>

void MQTT_NS::endpoint< Mutex, LockGuard, PacketIdBytes >::async_publish_at_most_once ( as::const_buffer  topic_name,
as::const_buffer  contents,
MQTT_NS::any  life_keeper,
bool  retain = false,
async_handler_t  func = async_handler_t() 
)
inline

Publish QoS0 topic_name and contents are reference type. So caller need to keep the lifetime of them until func is called.

Parameters
topic_nameA topic name to publish
contentsThe contents to publish
life_keeperAn object that stays alive (but is moved with std::move()) until the async operation is finished.
retainA retain flag. If set it to true, the contents is retained.
https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901104
3.3.1.3 RETAIN
funcfunctor object who's operator() will be called when the async operation completes.

contentsThe contents to publish
life_keeperAn object that stays alive (but is moved with std::move()) until the async operation is finished.
retainA retain flag. If set it to true, the contents is retained.
https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901104
3.3.1.3 RETAIN
funcfunctor object who's operator() will be called when the async operation completes.
Returns
If packet_id is used in the publishing/subscribing sequence, then returns false and contents doesn't publish, otherwise return true and contents publish.

◆ async_publish_exactly_once() [8/8]

template<typename Mutex = std::mutex, template< typename... > class LockGuard = std::lock_guard, std::size_t PacketIdBytes = 2>
bool MQTT_NS::endpoint< Mutex, LockGuard, PacketIdBytes >::async_publish_exactly_once ( packet_id_t  packet_id,
as::const_buffer  topic_name,
as::const_buffer  contents,
MQTT_NS::any  life_keeper,
bool  retain,
std::vector< v5::property_variant >  props,
async_handler_t  func = async_handler_t() 
)
inline

Publish QoS2 with a manual set packet identifier.

Parameters
packet_idpacket identifier
topic_nameA topic name to publish
contentsThe contents to publish
life_keeperAn object that stays alive (but is moved with std::move()) until the async operation is finished.
retainA retain flag. If set it to true, the contents is retained.
https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901104
3.3.1.3 RETAIN
propsProperties
See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901109
3.3.2.3 PUBLISH Properties
funcfunctor object who's operator() will be called when the async operation completes.
Returns
If packet_id is used in the publishing/subscribing sequence, then returns false and contents doesn't publish, otherwise return true and contents publish.

void MQTT_NS::endpoint< Mutex, LockGuard, PacketIdBytes >::async_read_next_message ( async_handler_t  func)
inline

Trigger next mqtt message manually. If you call this function, you need to set manual receive mode using set_auto_next_read(false);.

template<typename Mutex = std::mutex, template< typename... > class LockGuard = std::lock_guard, std::size_t PacketIdBytes = 2>
template<typename Arg0 , typename... Args>
packet_id_t MQTT_NS::endpoint< Mutex, LockGuard, PacketIdBytes >::async_subscribe ( std::string  topic_name,
std::uint8_t  option,
Arg0 &&  arg0,
Args &&...  args 
)
inline

Subscribe.

Parameters
topic_nameA topic name to subscribe
optionsubscription options
See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901169
3.8.3.1 Subscription Options
argsThe format of args is [topic_name, option, topicname, option, ...,][props,][func]
args should be zero or more pairs of topic_name and option. You can set props optionally. See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901164
3.8.2.1 SUBSCRIBE Properties You can set a callback function that is called when async operation will finish.
Returns
packet_id. packet_id is automatically generated.
You can subscribe multiple topics all at once.
See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901161

◆ async_subscribe() [2/20]

template<typename Mutex = std::mutex, template< typename... > class LockGuard = std::lock_guard, std::size_t PacketIdBytes = 2>
template<typename Arg0 , typename... Args>
bool MQTT_NS::endpoint< Mutex, LockGuard, PacketIdBytes >::async_subscribe ( packet_id_t  packet_id,
std::string  topic_name,
std::uint8_t  option,
Arg0 &&  arg0,
Args &&...  args 
)
inline

Subscribe with a manual set packet identifier.

Parameters
packet_idpacket identifier
topic_nameA topic name to subscribe
optionsubscription options
See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901169
3.8.3.1 Subscription Options
argsThe format of args is [topic_name, option, topicname, option, ...,][props,][func]
args should be zero or more pairs of topic_name and option. You can set props optionally. See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901164
3.8.2.1 SUBSCRIBE Properties You can set a callback function that is called when async operation will finish.
Returns
If packet_id is used in the publishing/subscribing sequence, then returns false and doesn't subscribe, otherwise return true and subscribes. You can subscribe multiple topics all at once.
See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901161

◆ async_subscribe() [12/20]

Parameters

topic_nameA topic name to subscribe
optionsubscription options
See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901169
3.8.3.1 Subscription Options
funcfunctor object who's operator() will be called when the async operation completes.
Returns
If packet_id is used in the publishing/subscribing sequence, then returns false and doesn't subscribe, otherwise return true and subscribes. You can subscribe multiple topics all at once.
See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901161

◆ async_subscribe() [14/20]

std::uint8_t  option,

std::uint8_t  reason,
Arg0 &&  arg0,
Args &&...  args 
)
inline

Send unsuback packet. This function is for broker.

Parameters
packet_idpacket id corresponding to subscribe
reasonreason_code
See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901194
3.11.3 UNSUBACK Payload
argsThe format of args is [option, option, ...,][props,][func]
You can set props as the last argument optionally. See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901190
3.11.2.1 UNSUBACK Properties You can set a callback function that is called when async operation will finish. See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc398718068

template<typename Mutex = std::mutex, template< typename... > class LockGuard = std::lock_guard, std::size_t PacketIdBytes = 2>

packet_id_t MQTT_NS::endpoint< Mutex, LockGuard, PacketIdBytes >::async_unsubscribe ( std::string  topic_name,
Arg0 &&  arg0,
Args &&...  args 
)
inline

Unsubscribe.

Parameters
topic_nameA topic name to unsubscribe
argsThe format of args is [topic_name, topicname, ... , ][props,][func]
args should be some topic_names to unsubscribe,
You can set props optionally. See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901182
3.10.2.1 UNSUBSCRIBE Properties You can set a callback function that is called when async operation will finish.
Returns
packet_id. packet_id is automatically generated.
You can subscribe multiple topics all at once.
See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901179

template<typename Mutex = std::mutex, template< typename... > class LockGuard = std::lock_guard, std::size_t PacketIdBytes = 2>
template<typename Arg0 , typename... Args>
bool MQTT_NS::endpoint< Mutex, LockGuard, PacketIdBytes >::async_unsubscribe ( packet_id_t  packet_id,
std::string  topic_name,
Arg0 &&  arg0,
Args &&...  args 
)
inline

Unsubscribe with a manual set packet identifier.

Parameters
packet_idpacket identifier
topic_nameA topic name to subscribe
argsThe format of args is [topic_name, topicname, ... , ][props,][func]
args should be some topic_names to unsubscribe,
You can set props optionally. See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901182
3.10.2.1 UNSUBSCRIBE Properties You can set a callback function that is called when async operation will finish.
Returns
If packet_id is used in the publishing/subscribing sequence, then returns false and doesn't unsubscribe, otherwise return true and unsubscribes. You can subscribe multiple topics all at once.
See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901179

◆ async_unsubscribe() [12/16]

Arg0 &&  arg0,

)
inline

Unsubscribe with a manual set packet identifier.

Parameters
packet_idpacket identifier
topic_nameA topic name to subscribe
argsThe format of args is [topic_name, topicname, ... , ][props,][func]

3.10.2.1 UNSUBSCRIBE Properties You can set a callback function that is called when async operation will finish.
Returns
If packet_id is used in the publishing/subscribing sequence, then returns false and doesn't unsubscribe, otherwise return true and unsubscribes. You can subscribe multiple topics all at once.
See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901179

◆ async_unsubscribe() [13/16]

template<typename Mutex = std::mutex, template< typename... > class LockGuard = std::lock_guard, std::size_t PacketIdBytes = 2>
bool MQTT_NS::endpoint< Mutex, LockGuard, PacketIdBytes >::async_unsubscribe ( packet_id_t  packet_id,
std::vector< std::string > const &  params,
async_handler_t  func = async_handler_t() 
)
inline

Unsubscribe.

Parameters
packet_idpacket identifier
paramsA collection of the topic name to unsubscribe
funcfunctor object who's operator() will be called when the async operation completes.
Returns
If packet_id is used in the publishing/subscribing sequence, then returns false and doesn't unsubscribe, otherwise return true and unsubscribes. You can subscribe multiple topics all at once.
See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901179

◆ disconnect()

template<typename Mutex = std::mutex, template< typename... > class LockGuard = std::lock_guard, std::size_t PacketIdBytes = 2>
void MQTT_NS::endpoint< Mutex, LockGuard, PacketIdBytes >::disconnect ( MQTT_NS::optional< std::uint8_t >  reason = MQTT_NS::nullopt,
std::vector< v5::property_variant >  props = {} 
)
inline

Disconnect Send a disconnect packet to the connected broker. It is a clean disconnecting sequence. The broker disconnects the endpoint after receives the disconnect packet.
When the endpoint disconnects using disconnect(), a will won't send.
See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901205

Parameters
reason_codeDISCONNECT Reason Code
See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901208
3.14.2.1 Disconnect Reason Code
propsProperties
See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901209
3.14.2.2 DISCONNECT Properties

◆ force_disconnect()

inline

Disconnect by endpoint Force disconnect. It is not a clean disconnect sequence.
When the endpoint disconnects using force_disconnect(), a will will send.

◆ handle_close_or_error()

◆ publish() [1/4]

template<typename Mutex = std::mutex, template< typename... > class LockGuard = std::lock_guard, std::size_t PacketIdBytes = 2>
packet_id_t MQTT_NS::endpoint< Mutex, LockGuard, PacketIdBytes >::publish ( std::string  topic_name,
std::string  contents,
std::uint8_t  qos = qos::at_most_once,
bool  retain = false,
std::vector< v5::property_variant >  props = {} 
)
inline

Publish.

Parameters
topic_nameA topic name to publish
contentsThe contents to publish
qosMQTT_NS::qos
retainA retain flag. If set it to true, the contents is retained.
https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901104
3.3.1.3 RETAIN
propsProperties
See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901109
3.3.2.3 PUBLISH Properties
Returns
packet_id. If qos is set to at_most_once, return 0. packet_id is automatically generated.
Note
If you know ahead of time that qos will be at_most_once, then prefer publish_at_most_once() over publish() as it is slightly more efficent.

◆ publish() [2/4]

template<typename Mutex = std::mutex, template< typename... > class LockGuard = std::lock_guard, std::size_t PacketIdBytes = 2>
packet_id_t MQTT_NS::endpoint< Mutex, LockGuard, PacketIdBytes >::publish ( as::const_buffer  topic_name,
as::const_buffer  contents,
MQTT_NS::any  life_keeper,
std::uint8_t  qos = qos::at_most_once,
bool  retain = false,
std::vector< v5::property_variant >  props = {} 
)
inline

Publish.

Parameters
topic_nameA topic name to publish
contentsThe contents to publish
life_keeperAn object that stays alive (but is moved with std::move()) until the async operation is finished.
qosMQTT_NS::qos
retainA retain flag. If set it to true, the contents is retained.
https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901104
3.3.1.3 RETAIN
propsProperties
See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901109
3.3.2.3 PUBLISH Properties
Returns
packet_id. If qos is set to at_most_once, return 0. packet_id is automatically generated.
Note
If you know ahead of time that qos will be at_most_once, then prefer publish_at_most_once() over publish() as it is slightly more efficent.

◆ publish() [3/4]

template<typename Mutex = std::mutex, template< typename... > class LockGuard = std::lock_guard, std::size_t PacketIdBytes = 2>
bool MQTT_NS::endpoint< Mutex, LockGuard, PacketIdBytes >::publish ( packet_id_t  packet_id,
std::string  topic_name,
std::string  contents,
std::uint8_t  qos = qos::at_most_once,
bool  retain = false,
std::vector< v5::property_variant >  props = {} 
)
inline

Publish with a manual set packet identifier.

Parameters
packet_idpacket identifier
topic_nameA topic name to publish
contentsThe contents to publish
qosMQTT_NS::qos
retainA retain flag. If set it to true, the contents is retained.
https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901104
3.3.1.3 RETAIN
propsProperties
See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901109
3.3.2.3 PUBLISH Properties
Returns
If packet_id is used in the publishing/subscribing sequence, then returns false and contents don't publish, otherwise return true and contents publish.

reason_codePUBREL Reason Code
See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901144
3.6.2.1 PUBREL Reason Code
propsProperties
See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901145
3.6.2.2 PUBREL Properties
life_keeperAn object that stays alive (but is moved with std::move()) until the async operation is finished.

◆ register_packet_id()

template<typename Mutex = std::mutex, template< typename... > class LockGuard = std::lock_guard, std::size_t PacketIdBytes = 2>
bool MQTT_NS::endpoint< Mutex, LockGuard, PacketIdBytes >::register_packet_id ( packet_id_t  packet_id)
inline

Register packet_id to the library. After registering the packet_id, you can call acquired_* functions. The ownership of packet id is moved to the library. Or you can call release_packet_id to release it.

Returns
If packet_id is successfully registerd then return true, otherwise return false.

◆ release_packet_id()

template<typename Mutex = std::mutex, template< typename... > class LockGuard = std::lock_guard, std::size_t PacketIdBytes = 2>
bool MQTT_NS::endpoint< Mutex, LockGuard, PacketIdBytes >::release_packet_id ( packet_id_t  packet_id)
inline

Release packet_id.

Parameters
packet_idpacket id to release. only the packet_id gotten by acquire_unique_packet_id, or register_packet_id is permitted.
Returns
If packet_id is successfully released then return true, otherwise return false.

◆ set_max_queue_send_count()

template<typename Mutex = std::mutex, template< typename... > class LockGuard = std::lock_guard, std::size_t PacketIdBytes = 2>
void MQTT_NS::endpoint< Mutex, LockGuard, PacketIdBytes >::set_max_queue_send_count ( std::size_t  count)
inline

Set maximum number of queued message sending. When async message sending function called during asynchronous processing, the message is enqueued. When current asynchronous message is processed, then concatenate queued messages and send it. This value limits the maximum number of concatenating messages. The default value is 1.

Parameters
countmaximum number of queued message sending. 0 means infinity.

◆ set_max_queue_send_size()

template<typename Mutex = std::mutex, template< typename... > class LockGuard = std::lock_guard, std::size_t PacketIdBytes = 2>
void MQTT_NS::endpoint< Mutex, LockGuard, PacketIdBytes >::set_max_queue_send_size ( std::size_t  size)
inline

Set maximum size of queued message sending. When async message sending function called during asynchronous processing, the message is enqueued. When current asynchronous message is processed, then concatenate queued messages and send it. This value limits the maximum size of concatenating messages. The default value is 0.

Parameters
sizemaximum size of queued message sending. 0 means infinity.

◆ set_mqtt_message_processed_handler()

template<typename Mutex = std::mutex, template< typename... > class LockGuard = std::lock_guard, std::size_t PacketIdBytes = 2>
void MQTT_NS::endpoint< Mutex, LockGuard, PacketIdBytes >::set_mqtt_message_processed_handler ( mqtt_message_processed_handler  h = mqtt_message_processed_handler())
inline

Set custom mqtt_message_processed_handler. The default setting is calling async_read_control_packet_type(). (See endpoint() constructor). The typical usecase of this function is delaying the next message reading timing. In order to do that 1) store func parameter of the mqtt_message_processed_handler. 2) call async_read_next_message with the stored func if you are ready to read the next mqtt message.

Parameters
hmqtt_message_processed_handler.

◆ set_packet_bulk_read_limit()

◆ suback() [1/2]

template<typename Mutex = std::mutex, template< typename... > class LockGuard = std::lock_guard, std::size_t PacketIdBytes = 2>
template<typename... Args>
void MQTT_NS::endpoint< Mutex, LockGuard, PacketIdBytes >::suback ( packet_id_t  packet_id,
Args &&...  args 
)
inline

Send suback packet. This function is for broker.

Parameters
packet_idpacket id corresponding to subscribe
reasonreason_code
See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901178
3.9.3 SUBACK Payload
argsadditional reason_code You can set props as the last argument optionally. See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901174
3.9.2.1 SUBACK Properties

◆ suback() [2/2]

template<typename Mutex = std::mutex, template< typename... > class LockGuard = std::lock_guard, std::size_t PacketIdBytes = 2>
void MQTT_NS::endpoint< Mutex, LockGuard, PacketIdBytes >::suback ( packet_id_t  packet_id,
std::vector< std::uint8_t >  reasons,
std::vector< v5::property_variant >  props = {} 
)
inline

Send suback packet. This function is for broker.

Parameters
packet_idpacket id corresponding to subscribe
reasonsa collection of reason_code
See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901178
3.9.3 SUBACK Payload
propsProperties
See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901174
3.9.2.1 SUBACK Properties

◆ subscribe() [1/7]

template<typename Mutex = std::mutex, template< typename... > class LockGuard = std::lock_guard, std::size_t PacketIdBytes = 2>
template<typename... Args>
packet_id_t MQTT_NS::endpoint< Mutex, LockGuard, PacketIdBytes >::subscribe ( MQTT_NS::string_view  topic_name,
std::uint8_t  option,
Args &&...  args 
)
inline

Subscribe.

Parameters
topic_nameA topic name to subscribe
optionsubscription options
See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901169
3.8.3.1 Subscription Options
argsargs should be zero or more pairs of topic_name and option. You can set props as the last argument optionally. See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901164
3.8.2.1 SUBSCRIBE Properties
Returns
packet_id. packet_id is automatically generated.
You can subscribe multiple topics all at once.
See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901161

template<typename Mutex = std::mutex, template< typename... > class LockGuard = std::lock_guard, std::size_t PacketIdBytes = 2>
template<typename... Args>
bool MQTT_NS::endpoint< Mutex, LockGuard, PacketIdBytes >::subscribe ( packet_id_t  packet_id,
Args &&...  args 
)
inline

Subscribe with a manual set packet identifier.

Parameters
packet_idpacket identifier
argsargs should be one or more pairs of topic_name and qos.

You can set props as the last argument optionally. See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901164
3.8.2.1 SUBSCRIBE Properties

Returns
If packet_id is used in the publishing/subscribing sequence, then returns false and doesn't subscribe, otherwise return true and subscribes. You can subscribe multiple topics all at once.
See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901161

template<typename Mutex = std::mutex, template< typename... > class LockGuard = std::lock_guard, std::size_t PacketIdBytes = 2>
template<typename... Args>
bool MQTT_NS::endpoint< Mutex, LockGuard, PacketIdBytes >::unsubscribe ( packet_id_t  packet_id,
Args &&...  args 
)
inline

Unsubscribe with a manual set packet identifier.

Parameters
packet_idpacket identifier
argsargs should be one or more topics You can set props as the last argument optionally. See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901182
3.10.2.1 UNSUBSCRIBE Properties
Returns
If packet_id is used in the publishing/subscribing sequence, then returns false and doesn't unsubscribe, otherwise return true and unsubscribes. You can subscribe multiple topics all at once.
See https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v5.0/os/mqtt-v5.0-os.html#_Toc3901179
